title: Kingdom Come Deliverance
notes: if you're running dual graphics setup (Intel/AMD) like me, you may encounter GPU hang issues to fix this, disable integrated GPU from UEFI settings. Use LLVM version 8.0.0.0 and latest Mesa driver to reduce the chance of GPU freezing. I have stress tested my setup, playing KCD for 4-5 hours, 0 freeze so far. It also run high setting preset/1080p 30fps locked.

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance
notes: 35-55 FPS, medium settings, 2560x1440, GPU constantly 100%. black screen problem fixed by copying d3dcompiler_46.dll and d3dcompiler_47.dll needs to be copied into the executable folder, see https://forum.kingdomcomerpg.com/t/linux-running-kc-d-with-wine/41173

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance
notes: To get it to run copy d3dcompiler_46.dll and d3dcompiler_47.dll from ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64Shared/ to: ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64/. Getting stuck at the loading screen fixed by adding "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" to the game's Launch Options in Steam (didn't have to do this on Ubuntu 16.04 when I tried). Performance is probably about halved compared to Windows 10 performance, but no unexpected performance drops otherwise. Some minor stuttering but mostly smooth.

Had to copy d3dcompiler_46.dll and d3dcompiler_47.dll from ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64Shared/ to: ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64/ and disable Esync by adding "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" to the launch options.  

Ran on High preset under Windows 7 with same hardware, 30-60 FPS, no problem. With Proton on Linux I barely get 30 FPS on Medium.
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

cpu: AMD Ryzen 3 2200G with Radeon Vega Graphics
notes: Copied d3dcompiler_46.dll and d3dcompiler_47.dll from ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64Shared/ to: ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/KingdomComeDeliverance/Bin/Win64/ and disabled Esync by adding "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" to the launch options. Hangs initially when loading into game, ~5 to 10 seconds. Generally runs between 30-35 FPS with everything set to high @ 1080p. No crashes, no major issues so far.
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

notes:

Hangs initially when loading into game, ~5 to 10 seconds. Generally runs between 30-35 FPS with everything set to high @ 1080p. No crashes, no major issues so far.

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

notes: With Proton 3.16-1 beta KCD runs beautifully.  I'm getting 40-55fps on Ultra 1080p including some of my Windows mods that copied over.  The game runs very smoothly, in fact smoother than in Windows  where I would get brief pauses sometimes when moving or rotating quickly.  The only tweak needed now is to copy the d3d.dlls  as listed in other reviews.  I no longer need any launch options at all.
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

notes:
To make the game run, copy all the contents of Win64Shared folder to Win64 folder. There is random stuttering but still playable.  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ltV-x74tp5g
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

notes:
There were 2 parts of running the game:

1. black screen on load, music in the background + cursor.
SOLUTION: Copied the whole Win64Shared content into Win64 folder

2. Running the game very low PFS (8-10!!!)
Solution: ??? (tried to disable Esync - does not work)

 You can follow the progress or suggest solution here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/379430/discussions/0/1734343065619417281/
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

notes: Needs both d3dcompiler*.dll files linked or copied from Win64Shared to Win64 in game directory, other than that runs perfectly well, 1080p on very high usually keeps around 60-70 fps but sometimes visibly stutters and drops to 30-ish for a second while loading stuff.
title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance
